item.title: Soil excavated to construct fence blocking/narrowing footpath, 31st October
item.description:
The footpath has been narrowed by the owner of the adjoining fence dumping soil on the footpath whilst excavating the footings to construct the fence. Pedestrians esp school children now have to walk dangerously close to the busy London Road due to both the narrowed footpath but now extensive vegetation has grown. See photo

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 332, London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: 26" x 13" x 4" deep, 31st October
item.description:
1 Brunswick Buildings Bethesda St Cheltenham GL50 2AZ You will know that I live on a very busy commuter street in Cheltenham, used by heavy goods vehicles and general traffic alike. You will also know from your records that I brought to your attention a pothole directly outside my property which was patch filled within the past 18 months or so. I attach photos of the pothole now. It's overall length is 26", 13" wide, 4". This pothole is as close to the front of my property as it could be. My front door and back gate both open directly onto the pavement which is permanently splattered in loose pieces of tarmac and road material which is then tracked into my house. No vehicles travelling this road can avoid the pothole since there is parking on the other side of the road leaving only one vehicle's width. I had my house painted in August 2021 and am dismayed to see the level of damage incurred to its' walls at low level, newly fitted window, new back gate and front door as a direct result of this pothole. In fact, for some time I have become hesitant and nervous when opening either door or gate to exit that I will be sprayed and harmed by flying pieces of sharp road material. This is true of course for all pedestrians. Please give this matter the urgency and attention it requires. Yours sincerely Rachel Tucker

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bethesda Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven surface and overgrown vegetation, 31st October
item.description:
Today a group of volunteers among with myself (Councillor Sarah Hands, Tewkesbury Borough Council) spent two hours clearing as much vegetation from this alley as possible as it had become impassible. I would like to see the county council finish the job. The path is extremely uneven with a lot of it taken over by soil and broken away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 31st October
item.description:
email rec 31/10/2023 Dear Sir or Madam My wife and I are in the process of refurbishing the above property, which we bought last autumn. We have discovered serious levels of moisture penetrating the north wall, being that facing the highway (Old Gloucester Road). The level of the carriageway and public footpath is significantly higher than that of the internal ground-floor. There is no land between the curtilage of the property and the highway, such that the tarmac footpath directly abuts the north wall. I am concerned that the surface water drainage or other pipework might have failed, leading to the subsoil beneath the highway and footpath becoming saturated. Whatever the underlying cause of the dampness, it will need to be remedied in order to prevent mould and other risks injurious to health. I look forward to hearing from you. Yours faithfully
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red Pedestrian and Vehicle lights out at SW corner of junction., 31st October
item.description:
Some lights have blown at this location. Red pedestrian and vehicle bulbs out at SW corner of junction of Fairview Rd and Winchcombe St. Also, I believe that some of the bulbs in the pedestrian crossing push buttons are also out, or the buttons are not working. I am not convinced that the pedestrian crossing activates when some of the buttons at this junction are pressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
